thread.title: High-school football | Week Eight: Hilliard Davidson improves to 7-1 with easy win
thread.title_full: High-school football | Week Eight: Hilliard Davidson improves to 7-1 with easy win | The Columbus Dispatch

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: High-school football | Week Eight: Hilliard Davidson improves to 7-1 with easy win
text:
The coaching staff surely will take the players to task about having four penalties, but Hilliard Davidson will enjoy what it sees when it reviews video of its 26-0 victory over Olentangy Liberty.
The Wildcats took another step toward winning the Ohio Capital Conference Central Division championship with exquisite ball control and an attacking defense on Friday night at Davidson.
Davidson (7-1, 5-0) intercepted a pass, recovered a fumble in the end zone for a touchdown, had three sacks and forced Liberty to turn the ball over on downs four times.
It was a matchup of a Davidson team that was ranked third in Division I, Region 2 of the computer point standings and a Liberty team that was second in Division I, Region I.
The Patriots (6-2, 3-2) played without star quarterback Alex Lando, who injured his right throwing shoulder against Westland last Friday. Senior Corbin Rapier started.
Davidson drove 67 yards on 16 plays on the first possession of the game for a touchdown. Ryan Royer ran for a 2-yard touchdown.
The drive was typical Wildcats in that they converted four third downs and kept the ball on the ground every play.
It was more of the same on Davidson’s second possession, a 94-yard, 15-play drive in which it converted two third downs and a fourth down.
The gamble on fourth-and-one at the Wildcats’ 15-yard line was what fans have come to expect from Brian White. Royer took a pitch and ran 3 yards around left end for the first down.
Liberty turned the ball over on downs twice in the first half, the first time when it drove to Davidson’s 15-yard line. A pass from Rapier was incomplete in the end zone.
The Patriots had another promising drive end on downs when Rapier was tackled for a 7-yard loss by lineman Dylan Day to the 32.
The turnover that sealed the outcome came with 1:52 left in the third quarter when defensive back Tyler Lomphoy made a diving interception at the Liberty 12-yard line.
Three plays later, Royer ran around right end for a 7-yard touchdown that made it 19-0.
Day recovered a fumbled snap in the end zone with 4:17 left to play for a touchdown. 
Results Hamilton Township 34, Bloom-Carroll 0:   Patrick Robinson completed 18 of 30 passes for 398 yards and four first-half touchdowns as Hamilton Township (6-2, 4-1) rolled past host Bloom-Carroll (5-3, 3-2) in the Mid-State League Buckeye. Mike Phimmasone caught four passes for 103 yards and Wes Payne scored a TD rushing and receiving . BOX SCORE 
Hartley 10, Watterson 0 : Quri Hickman had 26 carries for 184 yards and one TD, and Hartley (5-3) shut out host Watterson (4-4) in nonleague action. Hickman scored on a 36-yard run in the fourth quarter. Ben Hawk had Hartley's other score with a 20-yard field goal. Hartley held the Eagles to 113 total yards and had two interceptions . BOX SCORE
